page.title: 17SOUTH DEAN FARM
page.content: THE FARM IS ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE COAST ROAD IN THE VILLAGE OF BREAN. THE LAND HERE IS VERY FLAT AND IS PROTECTED FROM THE PREVAILING WINDS ONLY BY THE COASTAL SAND DUNES.THE SOIL IS SUITABLE ONLY FOR PASTURE AND A HERD OF FRIESIAN CATTLE PRODUCES MILK FOR THE LOCAL DAIRY AND ANIMALS FOR SLOUGHTER. IN COMMON WITH MOST FORMS IN THIS AREA,A STRIP OF LAND HAS BEEN SET ASIDE FOR USE BY CARAVANS.THESE ARE MOSTLY STATIC VANS.APART FROM TOILET BLOCKS AND WATER SUPPLIES,THERE IS NO PROVISION FOR THE HOLIDAY TAKEN,I.E. THERE IS A CARAVAN WHERE ONE CAN EAT,SLEEP AND REST BUT ENTERTAINMENT HAS TO BE SOUGHT ESLE WHERE. THE FARMHOUSE IS VERY OLD AND FARMING HAS BEEN CARRIED ON HERE FOR CENTURIES.
